 20  import re 
 21  from pyfbsdk import FBSystem 
 22  from pyfbsdk import FBProgress

 24  # get the whole list of components 
 25  kAllSceneComponents = FBSystem().Scene.Components

 27 -def deselect(pattern=None, **kwargs): 

 28      ''' 
 29      Deselects objects that match the given parameters 
 30      See ls function for available arguments 
 31      ''' 
 32      kwargs['selected'] = True 
 33       
 34      if not hasattr(pattern, '__iter__'): 
 35          pattern = [pattern] 
 36       
 37      for item in pattern: 
 38          matched = ls(pattern=item, **kwargs) 
 39          for obj in matched: 
 40              try: 
 41                  obj.component.Selected = False 
 42              except: 
 43                  obj.Selected = False 

 44   

 45 -def select(pattern=None, add=False, toggle=False, **kwargs): 

 46      ''' 
 47      Selects objects that match the given parameters 
 48      @param add: add the matched objects to the selection 
 49      @param toggle: toggles the selection of the matched objects 
 50      See ls function for additional arguments 
 51      ''' 
 52      if not hasattr(pattern, "__iter__"): 
 53          pattern = [pattern] 
 54       
 55      kwargs.pop('selected', None) 
 56       
 57      if not add and not toggle: 
 58          deselect(pattern=None, **kwargs) 
 59       
 60      if toggle: 
 61          def selectFunc(x): 
 62              try: 
 63                  x.component.Selected = not x.component.Selected 
 64              except: 
 65                  x.Selected = not x.Selected 

 66      else: 
 67          def selectFunc(x): 
 68              try: 
 69                  x.component.Selected = True 
 70              except: 
 71                  x.Selected = True 
 72                   
 73      for item in pattern: 
 74          matched = ls(pattern=item, **kwargs) 
 75          map(selectFunc, matched) 
 76       

 77 -def delete(pattern=None, **kwargs): 

 78      ''' 
 79      Deletes objects that match the given parameters 
 80      See ls function for additional arguments 
 81      ''' 
 82      if not hasattr(pattern, "__iter__"): 
 83          pattern = [pattern] 
 84       
 85      for item in pattern: 
 86          matched = ls(pattern=item, **kwargs) 
 87          for obj in matched: 
 88              try: 
 89                  obj.component.FBDelete() 
 90              except: 
 91                  obj.FBDelete()

 93 -def ls(pattern=None, type=None, selected=None, visible=None, includeNamespace=True): 

 94      ''' 
 95      Similar to Maya's ls command - returns list of objects that match the given parameters 
 96      @param pattern: name of an object with with optional wild cards '*' 
 97      @param type: object to compare if the component is of that type (either string or python class/type) 
 98      @param selected: True/False if the object is selected or not. Default is either 
 99      @param visible: True/False if the object is visible. Default is either  
100      @param includeNamespace: does the search use the complete name (with namespace)  Default True 
101      ''' 
102      # set up the name testing based on the pattern 
103      if pattern: 
104          # create a name return function 
105          if includeNamespace: 
106              getName = lambda x: getattr(x, 'LongName', x.Name) 
107          else: 
108              getName = lambda x: x.Name 
109           
110          # if there is a wild card in the pattern 
111          if '*' in pattern: 
112              pattern = pattern.replace('*', '.*') 
113              # name testing function 
114              passesNameTest = lambda x: re.match(pattern, getName(x)) 
115          else: 
116              passesNameTest = lambda x: pattern == getName(x)        
117      else: 
118          passesNameTest = lambda x: True 
119   
120      # for getting selection test 
121      if selected is not None: 
122          passesSelectionTest = lambda x: x.Selected == selected 
123      else: 
124          passesSelectionTest = lambda x: True 
125       
126      # for getting visibility test 
127      if visible is not None: 
128          passesVisibilityTest = lambda x: visible == bool(getattr(x, 'Visibility', False)) 
129      else: 
130          passesVisibilityTest = lambda x: True 
131       
132      # for testing the type of component 
133      if type: 
134          # if they gave a string, evaluate it 
135          if isinstance(type, basestring): 
136              try: 
137                  type = eval(type) 
138              except NameError: 
139                  raise NameError("Can not find object type '%s' in current namespace" % type) 
140   
141          passesTypeTest = lambda x: isinstance(x, type) 
142      # no type was given so its True by default 
143      else: 
144          passesTypeTest = lambda x: True 
145                  
146      matchList = [] 
147      for cmpnt in kAllSceneComponents: 
148          # if we did not pass the selection test, continue on 
149          if not passesSelectionTest(cmpnt): 
150              continue 
151          # check if the object is visible 
152          if not passesVisibilityTest(cmpnt): 
153              continue 
154          # do the same for matching type 
155          if not passesTypeTest(cmpnt): 
156              continue 
157           
158          if passesNameTest(cmpnt): 
159              # try converting it to a pymobu object 
160              try: 
161                  pmbCmpnt = cmpnt.ConvertToPyMoBu() 
162              except: 
163                  pmbCmpnt = cmpnt 
164                   
165              matchList.append(pmbCmpnt) 
166                      
167      return matchList 

168   

169 -def progressBarIterator(func, items): 

170      '''Function that displays a progress while looping a list of items through the function''' 
171      # can't figure out why it doesn't work 
172      # may convert this to a generator 
173      progressBar = FBProgress() 
174      progressBar.Caption = str(func.__name__) 
175      ret = [] 
176      num = len(items) 
177      try: 
178          for i, item in enumerate(items): 
179              progressBar.Text = str(item) 
180              progressBar.Percent = int(i/num) 
181              ret.append(func(item)) 
182      finally: 
183          progressBar.FBDelete() 
184       
185      return ret

190 -def decorated(origFunc, newFunc, decoration=None): 

191      """ 
192      Copies the original function's name/docs/signature to the new function, so that the docstrings 
193      contain relevant information again.  
194      Most importantly, it adds the original function signature to the docstring of the decorating function, 
195      as well as a comment that the function was decorated. Supports nested decorations. 
196      """ 
197      if not hasattr(origFunc, '_decorated'): 
198          # a func that has yet to be treated - add the original argspec to the docstring 
199          import inspect 
200          newFunc.__doc__ = "Original Arguments: %s\n\n%s" % ( 
201              inspect.formatargspec(*inspect.getargspec(origFunc)),  
202              inspect.getdoc(origFunc) or "") 
203      else: 
204          newFunc.__doc__ = origFunc.__doc__ or "" 
205      newFunc.__doc__ += "\n(Decorated by %s)" % (decoration or "%s.%s" % (newFunc.__module__, newFunc.__name__)) 
206      newFunc.__name__ = origFunc.__name__ 
207      newFunc.__module__ = origFunc.__module__ 
208      newFunc.__dict__ = origFunc.__dict__    # share attributes 
209      newFunc._decorated = True   # stamp the function as decorated 

210   

211 -def decorator(func): 

212      """ 
213      Decorator for decorators. Calls the 'decorated' function above for the decorated function, to preserve docstrings. 
214      """ 
215      def decoratorFunc(origFunc, *x): 
216          args = (origFunc,) + x 
217          if x: 
218              origFunc = x[0] 
219          newFunc = func(*args) 
220          decorated(origFunc, newFunc, "%s.%s" % (func.__module__, func.__name__)) 
221          return newFunc 

222      decorated(func,decoratorFunc, "%s.%s" % (__name__, "decorator")) 
223      return decoratorFunc
